message.raw:
Added signals for when the windows are first given a window ID by the
windowing system. This will tell us when we are able to make windows API
calls, which we need to do to control taskbar behaviour.

message.raw:
Resolves issue #12. Can now close tabs with ctrl-w, and switch tabs with
ctrl-tab and ctrl-shift-tab. The latter worked before but only if focus was on
the tab bar, now it works wherever focus is.

message.raw:
Resolves bitbucket issue #3. The top three tabs are now not movable.

This was a little tricky to do because Qt does not allow for setting individual
tabs movable or not. Furthermore, the relevant methods one has to override on
the QTabBar contain a lot of calls to private methods, which makes re-implementing
their behaviour more work than is worth it.

So instead, I did a bit of a hack - the subclassed TabBar keeps track of whether
its individual tabs are supposed to be movable or not, and it turns the global
setting on and off on mouseclick and mouserelease events, ensuring that when
you click an unmovable tab, you will find that it is unmovable and when you click
a movable tab, that it is movable.

It seems to work.

summary.html:
Resolves bitbucket issue #3. The top three tabs are now not movable.

This was a little tricky to do because Qt does not allow for setting individual
tabs movable or not. Furthermore, the relevant methods one has to override on
the QTabBar contain a lot of calls to private methods, which makes re-implementing
their behaviour more work than is worth it.

So instead, I did a bit of a hack - the subclassed TabBar keeps track of whether

values.message:
Resolves bitbucket issue #3. The top three tabs are now not movable.

This was a little tricky to do because Qt does not allow for setting individual
tabs movable or not. Furthermore, the relevant methods one has to override on
the QTabBar contain a lot of calls to private methods, which makes re-implementing
their behaviour more work than is worth it.

So instead, I did a bit of a hack - the subclassed TabBar keeps track of whether
its individual tabs are supposed to be movable or not, and it turns the global
setting on and off on mouseclick and mouserelease events, ensuring that when
you click an unmovable tab, you will find that it is unmovable and when you click
a movable tab, that it is movable.

It seems to work.

message.raw:
Fixed bitbucket issue #11. The shot output folder is now configurable in
labconfig. If not present, it defaults to %Y/%m/%d (with slashes according to OS)

It is as parsed by time.strftime()

Extra percent signs are needed as escape character in labconfig due to percent
symbols having special meaning in the config files:

[runmanager]
output_folder_format = %%Y-%%b/%%d
message.html:

It is as parsed by time.strftime()

Extra percent signs are needed as escape character in labconfig due to percent
symbols having special meaning in the config files:

[runmanager]
output_folder_format = %%Y-%%b/%%d

message.raw:
Resolves bitbucket issues #4, #5, #6, #7, #9, and #10.

#4 arrow keys now move selection up, down, left or right in globals tab and
   groups tab.

#5 Hitting enter when a cell is selected now enters edit mode on it.
   Furthermore, hitting enter or spacebar on a non-editable cell triggers
   its left-click action, whatever that may be.

#6 Tab now takes you to the next column after editing a global (shift-tab
   takes you back). This can no longer be used to edit cells that are supposed
   to be uneditable.

#7 After changing a value, if the units cell is empty is is highlighted for editing.

#9 Delete button moved back to the left for globals. Not as easy to move the
   delete button back to the left for groups, as treeviews where items have
   children only support the first item having children, and it would be silly
   to have the expansion button out next to empty space, since file rows in the
   groups tab don't have delete buttons.

#10 Creating a new group now automatically marks it as active and opens it.
message.html:

Furthermore, hitting enter or spacebar on a non-editable cell triggers

#6 Tab now takes you to the next column after editing a global (shift-tab
takes you back). This can no longer be used to edit cells that are supposed

#7 After changing a value, if the units cell is empty is is highlighted for editing.

#9 Delete button moved back to the left for globals. Not as easy to move the
delete button back to the left for groups, as treeviews where items have
children only support the first item having children, and it would be silly
to have the expansion button out next to empty space, since file rows in the
groups tab don't have delete buttons.

#10 Creating a new group now automatically marks it as active and opens it.

#4 arrow keys now move selection up, down, left or right in globals tab and
   groups tab.

#5 Hitting enter when a cell is selected now enters edit mode on it.
   Furthermore, hitting enter or spacebar on a non-editable cell triggers
   its left-click action, whatever that may be.

#6 Tab now takes you to the next column after editing a global (shift-tab

   to be uneditable.

#7 After changing a value, if the units cell is empty is is highlighted for editing.

#9 Delete button moved back to the left for globals. Not as easy to move the
   delete button back to the left for groups, as treeviews where items have
   children only support the first item having children, and it would be silly
   to have the expansion button out next to empty space, since file rows in the
   groups tab don't have delete buttons.

#10 Creating a new group now automatically marks it as active and opens it.

its imports, and the main app shows its window before loading the default
config file, which can be slow.

message.raw:
Wrote get_shot_globals function, which reads evaluated globals from a shot h5 file.

This method applies hacks to modify datatypes as they are read. In particular,
it converts null h5py.Reference objects to None.

At shot file creation time, the reverse conversion occurs, converting None
to null h5py.Reference objects. In this way we can store None as a global.

Also fixed a bug where error message formatting crashed due to a typo

At shot file creation time, the reverse conversion occurs, converting None

Also fixed a bug where error message formatting crashed due to a typo

message.raw:
Implemented martijn's improvements to glabals diffing from the other branch.

Slight improvement: whitespace differences are also ignored along with comments.
Also comments are stripped more robustltly than with .split('#').
Both of these are achieved with the stdlit tokenize module (which is
exactly for this sort of purpose).

As in the other branch's implementation, differences are only reported
if both the value and the expression that produced it (ignoring comments
and whitespace) differ. This is important because some types of objects
always give False on equality checks, so that produces false positives.

Fixed bug in dict_diff that improves its comparison of nnarrays.

Made ctrl-c kill the program

Made groups open on double click (and go to the appropriate tab)
message.html:
Implemented martijn's improvements to glabals diffing from the other branch.

Slight improvement: whitespace differences are also ignored along with comments.
Also comments are stripped more robustltly than with .split('#').
Both of these are achieved with the stdlit tokenize module (which is
exactly for this sort of purpose).

As in the other branch's implementation, differences are only reported
if both the value and the expression that produced it (ignoring comments
and whitespace) differ. This is important because some types of objects
always give False on equality checks, so that produces false positives.

Fixed bug in dict_diff that improves its comparison of nnarrays.

Made ctrl-c kill the program

Made groups open on double click (and go to the appropriate tab)

Slight improvement: whitespace differences are also ignored along with comments.
Also comments are stripped more robustltly than with .split('#').
Both of these are achieved with the stdlit tokenize module (which is
exactly for this sort of purpose).

As in the other branch's implementation, differences are only reported
if both the value and the expression that produced it (ignoring comments
and whitespace) differ. This is important because some types of objects
always give False on equality checks, so that produces false positives.

Fixed bug in dict_diff that improves its comparison of nnarrays.

Made ctrl-c kill the program

Made groups open on double click (and go to the appropriate tab)

values.message:
Implemented martijn's improvements to glabals diffing from the other branch.

Slight improvement: whitespace differences are also ignored along with comments.
Also comments are stripped more robustltly than with .split('#').
Both of these are achieved with the stdlit tokenize module (which is
exactly for this sort of purpose).

As in the other branch's implementation, differences are only reported
if both the value and the expression that produced it (ignoring comments
and whitespace) differ. This is important because some types of objects
always give False on equality checks, so that produces false positives.

Fixed bug in dict_diff that improves its comparison of nnarrays.

Made ctrl-c kill the program

Made groups open on double click (and go to the appropriate tab)

Set version to 2.0

message.raw:
Fixing issue where clicking checkboxes in the treeview wouldn't emit the
'pressed' signal. We now subclass and hook into mouseReleaseEvent, emitting the
custom signal mouseLeftRelease instead. This one *is* emitted when checkboxes are
clicked on.

Working on making the parent and child checkboxes consistent in the groups tab
message.html:
Fixing issue where clicking checkboxes in the treeview wouldn't emit the
'pressed' signal. We now subclass and hook into mouseReleaseEvent, emitting the
custom signal mouseLeftRelease instead. This one is emitted when checkboxes are
clicked on.

Working on making the parent and child checkboxes consistent in the groups tab

summary.raw:
Fixing issue where clicking checkboxes in the treeview wouldn't emit the
'pressed' signal. We now subclass and hook into mouseReleaseEvent, emitting the
custom signal mouseLeftRelease instead. This one *is* emitted when checkboxes are
clicked on.

Working on making the parent and child checkboxes consistent in the groups tab
summary.html:
Fixing issue where clicking checkboxes in the treeview wouldn't emit the
'pressed' signal. We now subclass and hook into mouseReleaseEvent, emitting the
custom signal mouseLeftRelease instead. This one is emitted when checkboxes are
clicked on.

Working on making the parent and child checkboxes consistent in the groups tab

values.message:
Fixing issue where clicking checkboxes in the treeview wouldn't emit the
'pressed' signal. We now subclass and hook into mouseReleaseEvent, emitting the
custom signal mouseLeftRelease instead. This one *is* emitted when checkboxes are
clicked on.

Working on making the parent and child checkboxes consistent in the groups tab

message.raw:
Starting branch for Qt port. The last three commits in the default branch
are part of the Qt port, but are subsequently reverted in the default branch.

Henceforth default branch is gtk, Qt branch is for Qt port.

When Qt port is stable, it will be merged back in to default.

message.raw:
Fixed bug where experiment folder name would be incorrect

If the labscript file name (excluding extension) ended with the letters 'p' or 'y', these letters would be missing from the folder name automatically generated by runmanager for storing experiments. This is because we were using strip('.py') which removes the *list* of characters specified from the end of a string until a character not in the list was found.
For instance the following statements are True:
'exp.py'.strip('.py') == 'ex'
'expyy.ypypp.py'.strip('.py') == 'ex'

message.raw:
fixed bug in restoration of output dir

There were a couple of instance variables that were not being restored correctly (one wasn't even saved) which were preventing the output directory from auto-updating when restoring the runmanager state and also preventing the "reset dir" icon (next to the output directory chooser) from working as expected.

*This issue will persist until you resave the runmanager configuration file.* After this, when you restore the file on *future* days, the output dir will be correctly updated. Unfortunately I can't correct the behaviour unless you do this!

refs #451

message.raw:
fixes #770 (in a better way)

I've modified the solution to #770 by overriding the dictionary class of the dictionary of variables passed to the eval() function. This allows us to trace which globals a particular global depends on. This was particularly important because of the following issue:

Imagine a global that was defined as: 7 if condition else a_list_of_values

In the previous code, the global would be found to depend on a_list_of_values regardless of the state of condition. In the new code, it determines dependencies based on what the eval() function requests access to, and so the dependencies do depend on the state of condition as one would expect.

The only "strange" behaviour now is if you set a global to: list_1 if za_list_of_conditions else list_2
In this case, the global will be added to a zip group with 'za_list_of_conditions' (note that "if za_list_of_conditions" always evaluates to True if it is a non empty list) rather than the more obvious option of adding it to a zip group with 'list_1'. Whether the global is added to a zip group with 'list_1' or 'za_list_of_conditions' depends on the global names (the zip group picked is the last dependency in alphabetical order). You can of course, always override the runmanager defaults yourself if you ever encounter an instance like this!

message.raw:
Added the capability to load/save runmanager state.

Just use the entries located in the File menu!
Will remove the "load runmanager defaults" code Russ wrote from the labconfig file (and associated runmanager code) and make runmanager automatically save/load state on exit/start. Users will also be able to save/load their own configurations independently of this.

Also need to save/load the state of:
* Sort order of globals for each group
* Sort order of files loaded in the "Group" tab
* column sizes for all treeviews

refs #451
